intro: Calochortus euumbellatus, commonly known as the desert mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of spring-blooming species known for their showy, often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, with a distinctive, recurved shape, and it produces a bulbous root system for storage of water and nutrients. Calochortus euumbellatus is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
